actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business.
Committee on Small Business. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 98-9.
Committee on Small Business. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.
Committee on Small Business. Reported to Senate by Senator Weicker with an amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Regular Orders. Calendar No. 3.
Measure laid before Senate.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Passed House (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Senate disagreed to House amendments, requested a conference and appointed conferees. Weicker; Boschwitz; Pressler; Nunn; Levin.
House Insisted on its Amendments by Unanimous Consent.
House Agreed to Request for Conference and Speaker Appointed Conferees: Mitchell, Smith (IA), Addabbo, LaFalce, Wyden, Eckart, Savage, Luken, McDade, Conte, Broomfield, Williams (OH).
Conferees agreed to file conference report.
Conference Report 98-262 Filed in House.
Senate agreed to conference report by Voice Vote.
House Agreed to Conference Report by Yea-Nay Vote: 367 - 6 (Record Vote No: 236).
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 98-47.

official_title: An act to amend section 8(a) of the Small Business Act.
short_title: Minority Small Business Pilot Procurement Act of 1983

summary.text: (Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 98-262) Amends the Small Business Act to authorize the President to designate, within 60 days of the enactment of this Act, the agency (other than the Department of Defense) with which a Government procurement contract shall be made by the Small Business Administration (SBA) under the provisions pursuant to which contracts are performed through subcontracts with socially and economically disadvantaged small businesses. Prohibits the SBA from entering into such a contract prior to October 1, 1983, or after September 30, 1985. Provides that the Administrator's authority to waive any bond that may be required for a small business concern to receive a subcontract under this Act may not be exercised prior to October 1, 1983, or after September 30, 1985.
